did.unittitle: John W. Ferguson photograph collection circa 1919
did.abstract: Papers of a soldier in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition."

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Matthew Ferguson in February 2012 (Donor No. 10730)

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open without restriction.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, John W. Ferguson photograph collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: John W. Ferguson, of Ravenna, Mich., served in Company C, 310th Engineers, during the American intervention in Russia, 1918-1919, the "Polar Bear Expedition."

scopecontent.p: Photograph of John W.Ferguson, a soldier in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, riding a horse in Russia, possibly in Murmansk.
